result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P. Gritzner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court IMPOSES a sentence of 4 months jail on each count, consecutive to each other and consecutive to any sentence already in being 
The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Gritzner on Probation for a term of 2 years
Consecutive to: any sentence already in being

miscConds.notes:
--no contact with Kristin Petrie, except through lawyer/attorney

--no acts or threats of violence

--no possession or ingestion of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming

--submit DNA sample

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: WATERTOWN PD
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per agent

--no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition 

--The Court orders that the Glock 19 handgun serial number KEV169 to forfeit and disposed of

timeConds.notes:
--On Count #1: to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on 5/13/16 at 6:00pm 

---Mr. Gritzner is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:10pm [mo]
Defendant Jason P. Gritzner in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments give by Counsel

On each Count:
The Court IMPOSES a sentence of 4 months jail on each count, consecutive to each other and consecutive to any sentence already in being 
The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Gritzner on Probation for a term of 2 years, with conditions: 

--On Count #1: to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on 5/13/16 at 6:00pm 
---Mr. Gritzner is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.


--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Kristin Petrie, except through lawyer/attorney
-no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition 
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores 
--submit DNA sample
--pay DNA surcharge
--to pay statutory costs, including to 10% restitution surcharge
--to pay restitution in the amount of $626.74 to Kristin Petrie



Days credit for time already served:  2 days
recess: 2:20pm--reconvene at 2:42pm

DA Happ indicates that she mis-read the complaint and there is not a domestic abuse surcharge
The Court vacates the imposition of the Domestic Surcharge and vacate any reference to Domestic Abuse sentencing transcript

The Court orders that the Glock 19 handgun serial number KEV169 to forfeit and disposed of
recess: 2:44pm
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 3:38 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jason P. Gritzner in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1, #3 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #5
DA Happ files victim impact statement 
Atty Hagemann requests sentencing at later date, presents basis, including self-employment, recent eviction
Court grants adjournment; reminds Mr. Gritzner that his bond/conditions remain in effect while the case is pending and cautions Mr. Gritzner about any bond violations between now and sentencing
Recess: 3:49 pm

NEXT: Sentencing on 5/5/16 at 2:00pm

Case called at 9:31am [mo]
Defendant Jason P. Gritzner in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Hagemann gives case update; indicates that State has not provided a settlement offer as of yet.
The Court directs the State to provide Atty. Hagemann with a settlement offer by end of business tomorrow, or communicate that there will not be an offer.
The Court reminds Mr. Gritzner that his bond and its conditions remain in effect and that the last opportunity to enter a plea is the FSSC
recess: 9:34am

Case called at 2:02  pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jason P. Gritzner in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann: Still negotiating settlement, just got information to ADA Teuber this week, requests additional STC in 30 days.
DA Happ: No objection to additional STC, but also request matter be set for trial as well, case is getting aged
Atty Hageman: No objection
Counsel agree one day will be needed
Recess: 2:08 pm

NEXT:  (1) Schedule STC 3/10/16 at 9:30 - Send notices (2) Schedule FSSC 3/24/16 at 3:00 pm - Send notices (3) Schedule JT 4/4/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 2:08 pm [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jason P. Gritzner in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann: Still negotiating matter, request an additional status conference in 30 days
ADA Beck: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Gritzner that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 2:09 pm

NEXT: Schedule STC 1/29/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 9/15/15

Case called at 1:22 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jason P. Gritzner appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Hagemenn informs the Court that Mr. Gritzner is eligible for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court indicates that all charges are misdemeanors on complaint; appears to have wrong case designation - requests new case designation
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $3500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No possession of any dangerous weapons to include knives and firearms
-No contact with Kristin Petrie  

COURT ORDERS CASE TO BE RENUMBERED TO 15CM340
Recess: 1:32 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 9/30/15 at 9:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/30/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
